txt.en: 'Aeglas has been freed and has returned to the field, you say? You have done well, [placeholder].'
'Come little goblin, let us make our way to freedom.'
'Guard me, while I free the others. Stay close.'
The Great Escape
'We should move swiftly. The exit is not far now.'
Aeglas is slain. You have failed
Aeglas and Glorwen have found their way to freedom
Aeglas must be protected as he attempts to lead Glorwen and Oghûk to safety. It falls to you to defend him along the way.
'Let us slow our speed and be cautious approaching the other Elf.'
'Let us see the conviction of this goblin's words. If he proves true, then we shall see him to freedom.'
Glóin is just outside the entrance to Goblin-town.\n\nWith your aid, Aeglas and Glorwen escaped to safety. Oghûk proved as treacherous as any goblin. You should report your victories to Glóin.
'I gives thanks for freedom. Good Elf-friend.'
'I will return now to my post. All is well thanks to you, friend.'
'We are close now. Onward to freedom!'
'I did not think the creature could be redeemed, but I would rather prove their evil than slaughter them without thought.'
'Let us slow our pace and see if we can save the dwarf the goblins had taken.'
Speak with Aeglas
'Come to freedom, friend Elf.'
See Aeglas safely from the Goblin-town prison
Talk to Glóin at his camp outside of Goblin-town
'Thank you, I will be safe from here.'
'We were too late for this poor soul. She is gone.'
After you recovered the master key from the goblin-torturer, Aeglas decided it is time to depart from Goblin-town.
'Now you die!'

'My plan has not worked. The goblins were prepared, though I do not know how. It matters not though. Now that we have a key the time has come for us to leave this place, [placeholder]. We shall need to be cautious. Glorwen must be taken from here, and we will test the truth in Oghûk's words.\n\n'Tell me when you are prepared, and we shall begin our escape.'
